intro: Ardisia mesoamericana, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Central America and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Ardisia mesoamericana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
